text:
I didn't find it there, but someone suggested I look in my email and the link in that email took me to my score page.

Thank you.

text:
You will not interview on day 2. 

See the paragraph 3, point 1 in this post for full details: <https://ptwebdevallhu-iu32728.slack.com/archives/C068SQ71S00/p1703210835623029|https://ptwebdevallhu-iu32728.slack.com/archives/C068SQ71S00/p1703210835623029>

attachments.fallback:
[December 21st, 2023 6:07 PM] melinda: <!channel> Hi! Just want to address some commonly asked questions. A fair number of you did not get to interview today. I know it must be frustrating to have prepped and not get to go. Thank you to the few of you we were able to reschedule last minute. With so many moving parts and changes, I really appreciate everyone's patience.

For anyone who did not get to go:
1. You will interview on January 15. 
2. If you need to retake after that, we will schedule with you (likely pulling you from a portion of class sometimes after Day 2).
For folks who did go:
1. You will receive your scores in January. Anyone who scored less than a 4 on any category today will be notified prior to Interview Day 2. Hopefully, everyone who needs to retake will be able to on Day 2. However, we will prioritize based on volunteer availability in the following order: A) Folks who did not get to interview today B) Folks who did not score a 3 in at least one area C) Folks who did not score a 4 in at least one area and are aiming for the apprenticeship program. 
2. If you need to retake following Day 2, we will work on a schedule for those following that class.
3. If you scored 4s or higher in all 3 categories, you may not hear from us regarding feedback until a little later as we prioritize the makeups. But you will receive that feedback as well. 
Send any questions you may have to Lexi, Colin, and myself, and we will get back to you when we are all back in office. Thanks everyone! Happy Holidays!

Thank you to the few of you we were able to reschedule last minute. With so many moving parts and changes, I really appreciate everyone's patience.

For anyone who did not get to go:

2. If you need to retake after that, we will schedule with you (likely pulling you from a portion of class sometimes after Day 2).
For folks who did go:
1. You will receive your scores in January. Anyone who scored less than a 4 on any category today will be notified prior to Interview Day 2. Hopefully, everyone who needs to retake will be able to on Day 2. However, we will prioritize based on volunteer availability in the following order: A) Folks who did not get to interview today B) Folks who did not score a 3 in at least one area C) Folks who did not score a 4 in at least one area and are aiming for the apprenticeship program. 
2. If you need to retake following Day 2, we will work on a schedule for those following that class.
3. If you scored 4s or higher in all 3 categories, you may not hear from us regarding feedback until a little later as we prioritize the makeups. But you will receive that feedback as well. 
Send any questions you may have to Lexi, Colin, and myself, and we will get back to you when we are all back in office. Thanks everyone! Happy Holidays!

You will not interview on day 2. 

See the paragraph 3, point 1 in this post for full details:

text: Thanks Erin! To further provide context, there will be no lecture and it is a work day. So, while attendance is not required, I highly recommend using that time to work with your team on your project, as Project Reviews will take place the following class.
